title: The Greek Maiden and the English Lord
description: A "Happily Ever After" book in the tradition of Jane Austen's  Pride and Prejudice, and Emma ,  The Greek Maiden and the English Lord is a historical romance that delves into prejudice and principles - and the fight for one's identity.                                                              In 1831, sixteen year old gypsy Lily embarks on a journey to England in search of her parents. Her cousins in England realize how little she knows about being a lady and send her to a boarding school in York to learn refinement and await her father's return from the Indies. There, she falls in love with Edward Grant, an English lord, who is engaged to another.News of her father dying in a shipwreck sets Lily's whole world reeling. Penniless, she is forced to work at the boarding school as a maid to pay her tuition. Her gypsy past comes to the surface to haunt her. Will Edward's love for Lily be strong enough to overcome the prejudices of the upper English class?
author: Patty Apostolides
